original: Brunnström, Axel Robert Sture, major, Halmstad, f. 23/5/99 i Välinge, Malmöh. 1., av godsäg. Sture B. o. Alice Gravenhorst-Lövenstierne. — Studiex. v. Lundsbergs sk. 17, res :-off :ex. v. Karlberg 19, agron. v. Aln-arp 21, husdj :konsulent där 23. Res. t. Tyskl., Schweiz 21-22, Storbritann. 23-24, USA 25. Fänr. i Skånska hus :-reg. res. 19, und ilöjtn. 21, löjtn. 24, ryttm. i Skånska kav:reg. res. 37, kapt. v. Hall. reg. 40, major där 46. Eget lantbr. 27-43. Ordf. i Välinge kom-m: stämma 32-40, komm:fullm., skolstyr., anb :lö’sh :komm., I. 16 konstkl., Kullabygd. rytt:fören., Halmstads flygkl. segelfl :sekt., Anglo-Swed. Soc. i Halmstad 43 o. 47, sekr. o. master i Hall. fältrittkl. 42. Skr.: Ett flert. lantbr :art. i facktidskr. o. dagspr. 22-39. Hobbies : jakt, flugfiske, ridn., se-gelflygn. RSOlkl, RDDO, Dansk FrihM.
translated: Brunnström, Axel Robert Sture was a major from Halmstad, born on May 23, 1899 in Välinge, Malmöhus. He was the first son of landowner Sture B. and Alice Gravenhorst-Lövenstierne. Axel attended Lundberg's School and passed the officer's examination at Karlberg in 1919. He received a degree in agriculture from Alnarp in 1921 and became a livestock consultant there in 1923. He traveled to Germany and Switzerland from 1921-1922 and to the United States in 1925. He served as a ensign in the Scania Hussar Regiment in 1919, lieutenant in 1921, and captain in the Halland Regiment in 1940. He was a farmer from 1927-1943. He was chairman of the Välinge municipal meeting from 1932-1940 and a member of the municipal council, school board, welfare committee, Art Club, Kulla Equestrian Association, Halmstad Aviation Club's gliding section, Anglo-Swedish Society in Halmstad in 1943 and 1947, secretary and master of the Halland Field Riding Club in 1942. His written works include articles on agriculture in professional journals and newspapers from 1922-1939. His hobbies included hunting, fly fishing, horseback riding, and gliding. He was awarded the Order of the Sword (RSO), the Royal Swedish Aero Club's Gold Medal (RSOlkl), the Royal Order of Dannebrog (RDDO), and the Danish Freedom Medal. He married in 19xx.

structured.name: Axel Robert Sture Brunnström

awards.name: Royal Swedish Aero Club's Gold Medal

structured.description: Axel Robert Sture Brunnström was a Swedish Major who was born in Välinge, Malmöhus in 1899. He was the first son of landowner Sture B. and Alice Gravenhorst-Lövenstierne. Axel attended Lundberg's School and Karlberg and received a degree in agriculture from Alnarp. He became a livestock consultant and traveled to Germany, Switzerland, and the United States. He served in the Scania Hussar Regiment and Halland Regiment. Axel was a farmer and served on several committees including the Välinge municipal meeting, municipal council, school board, welfare committee, Art Club, Kulla Equestrian Association, Halmstad Aviation Club's gliding section, Anglo-Swedish Society in Halmstad, and Halland Field Riding Club. He wrote several articles on agriculture and enjoyed hunting, fly fishing, horseback riding, and gliding. Axel received several awards including the Order of the Sword, the Royal Swedish Aero Club's Gold Medal, the Royal Order of Dannebrog, and the Danish Freedom Medal.
